Cards

Cards are containers that can hold a variety of content such as text, images and buttons. They are often used on mobile devices as a common information presentation pattern.

Examples

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Standard Cards

These are basic cards provided through Bootstrap.

This is some text within a card body.

Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of the card's content.

Content Cards

Content cards only contain text and images in various layouts, including lists and paragraphs.

New John Deere 469 Silage Special Round Baler
$5,678.44
Stock Status Transfer Pending
Vehicle ID 100000038232
Association -
RRS Date -

Actionable Cards

Actionable cards allow the user interaction to add content or manipulate the displayed data.

New John Deere 469 Silage Special Round Baler
$5,678.44
Stock Status Transfer Pending
Vehicle ID 100000038232
Association -
RRS Date -
Duplicate Remove
New John Deere 469 Silage Special Round Baler
$5,678.44
Stock Status Transfer Pending
Vehicle ID 100000038232
Association -
RRS Date -
Remove

Guidelines

  • Each card should contain content related to one idea.
  • Make the entire card clickable, excluding the action buttons area at the bottom of the card where applicable. The larger touch target area provides improved mobile usability.
  • Use cards as an entry point to a more detailed view of an item by displaying short descriptions or content previews and allowing the user to click for full information.
  • Include images or icons on your cards to make them more appealing to users.

Documentation

Bootstrap Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
.uxf-uxf-card-product add class to div.card element and add the necessary HTML as shown above to apply content card styles
.card-footer add class to div element after div.card-body to apply footer styles
